objetive.1: Without change there is no innovation, creativity, or incentive for improvement. Those who initiate change will have a better chance of managing the change that is inevitable. - William Pollard.

info.1: Information Technology and Communications Engineer and passionate about web development.

description.1: Design of intuitive and attractive interfaces that enhance user experience and maximize conversions.
description.2: Custom website creation, optimized for performance and SEO, using the latest technologies.
description.3: End-to-end application development, from backend to frontend, ensuring seamless integration and scalability.

OBJECTIVE.text: Being part of a company where I can put into practice all my knowledge, to give me the opportunity to reach all my goals set, and that offers me the opportunity to grow in the area work, personal and intellectual.

2.title: Information Technologies and Communications Engineering
2.subtitle: Instituto Tecnológico Superior del Occidente del Estado de Hidalgo (ITSOEH)

1.title: Mobile developer and UI designer
1.subtitle: Ciclo-pep
1.description: I was part of the backend and frontend development team for the “Eco Guardianes” project, as well as making some mockups and images for the application.

2.title: Web developer
2.subtitle: Social Service at ITSOEH
2.description: Full-stack development of the “App Web Lecturas” platform to record, analyze and present data on learning matters at the Linus Pauling school, Progreso de Obregón, Hgo. Making use of technologies like MySql, PHP, JQuery, HTML, Javascript and Bootstrap.

3.title: Software developer
3.subtitle: Actosoft Community
3.description: Member of the frontend development team with technologies like Javascript, CSS, HTML, SASS, Styled components, Typescript, React.js and Firebase for web applications. Lead Teacher in courses provided by Actosoft.

4.title: Freelancer
4.subtitle: Freelancer
4.description: I taught an introductory online course called “Web development - create your own website“ including technologies like Git, HTML, CSS, Javascript and SASS.

5.title: Frontend developer
5.subtitle: Fixter
5.description: I was part of the development team implementing frontend technologies like React.js, Redux and Ant design.

6.title: Frontend Developer
6.subtitle: Sodisa
6.description:
Joined the team as frontend developer and quickly took ownership of the internal logistics system after team transition.

Enhanced UI/UX and implemented real-time tracking for stock and SKUs, helping reduce product loss and improve operational visibility.

Introduced clean architecture principles and improved app performance through component refactoring.

Stack: React, Next.js, TypeScript, Figma, CSS Modules.

7.title: Fullstack Developer
7.subtitle: Lapzo
7.description:
Worked on the corporate training platform for national and international enterprise clients across diverse industries.

Improved course search speed and dashboard performance using optimized SQL queries and caching.

Supported backend work with Express and Hasura, improving API reliability and maintainability.

Worked closely with cross-functional teams to ensure technical scalability and alignment with business goals.

Stack: React, TypeScript, Express, Hasura, PostgreSQL.

8.title: Lead Frontend Developer
8.subtitle: Zenda.la
8.description:
First in-house frontend engineer; rebuilt the health-insurance web app with a new UI/UX, improving usability and performance.

Implemented key features: subscription management, plan upgrades, payment history, gamification, and biological-age calculator.

Developed a new Next.js landing page, improving SEO and performance metrics.

Created a JavaScript SDK for partners to embed insurance account access via a single script.

Mentored a junior frontend engineer and worked closely with product design.

Stack: Next.js, React, TypeScript, MUI, Redux, Styled Components, Ghost, Segment, GTM, GA.

9.title: Fullstack Engineer
9.subtitle: Clara
9.description:
Developing internal platforms that empower operations and finance teams to manage user accounts, cards, and transactions efficiently across LATAM.

Building and improving modules for Users, Cards, Reports, Transactions, and Access Control using React and TypeScript.

Collaborating with backend teams using Java (Spring Boot) to integrate and optimize APIs for transaction and card operations.

Currently driving the migration from Retool to React, modernizing internal tooling to enhance scalability and reduce dependency on low-code systems.

Stack: React, TypeScript, Java, Spring Boot, AWS, PostgreSQL, Retool.
